p: While both the ST-246-resistant viruses formed large plaques in the presence or absence of 2 Î¼M ST-246, a concentration of ST-246 over 50-fold higher than its IC50 value, treatment with PA104, PA24, and PA63 caused a considerable reduction in viral plaque size. As shown in Figure 5B, all three compounds substantially reduced the size of RV2 plaques. For RV1, on the other hand, PA104 was markedly more effective in reducing viral spread than PA24 and PA63 ( Figure 5B). Overall, these data show that retrograde inhibitors can block EV formation and spread of ST-246-resistant VACV.
